Package io.github.augustoravazoli.termenu.io

Class Terminal

java.lang.Object
io.github.augustoravazoli.termenu.io.Terminal
public abstract sealed class Terminal extends Object
Terminal is the abstract class that provides an abstraction layer for the I/O system, it's implemented using the singleton design pattern since it's a shared resource.
Since:
3.0.0
Author:
Augusto Ravazoli

      Reads a line from the terminal input.
      Returns:

    • readPassword

      public abstract char[] readPassword()
      Reads a char array from the terminal input. If the environment supports echoing, it will be enabled.
      Returns:
      a char array

    • writeLine

      public abstract void writeLine(String format, Object... args)
      Writes a formatted string to the terminal output, breaking a line at the end.
      Parameters:
      format - the format
      args - the args

    • write

      public abstract void write(String format, Object... args)
      Writes a formatted string to the terminal output.
      Parameters:
      format - the format
      args - the args

    • clear

      public abstract boolean clear()
      Clears the terminal output if the current environment supports it.
      Returns:
      true if the terminal was cleared; false otherwise.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the execution until ENTER key is pressed.

    • confirm

      public boolean confirm(String message)
      Displays a message and ask confirmation.
      Parameters:
      message - the message
      Returns:
      true if yes; false if no.

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Exits the program.
